content: When this happens, it is usually for one of two possibilities: either the setup is incorrect, or the password is wrong. If the setup is incorrect, someone here may have suggestions. If the password is wrong, you need to contact your email provider.
creator: davidsk

content: The problem is that it is the email provider making that request, not Thunderbird. That could be an incorrect account setting, or that you need a new password.
creator: davidsk

content: ALL email accounts require passwords, including Orange. Depending on the email provider's policies, you may be able to use the password stored on old computer. click settings>privacy&security and click the saved passwords button and then the show passwords button. Prior to displaying that, thunderbird may prompt for your Windows login PIN (assuming you use Windows).
creator: davidsk

content: There are no shortcuts. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/keyboard-shortcuts-thunderbird lists all available key combos.

content:
It would be helpful if you posted an image showing the entire Thunderbird window.

Please state what OS you use and also what version?

Where did you get the Thunderbird download ? Was it from this official download webpage: https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/

if no then where did you get it ? Windows App ? Snap? Flatpak ?
creator: Toad-Hall

content: We can answer half the question, and we leave it to Mailchimp for the other half. Click to addressbook pane, highlight the addressbook, and click the three dots to the right which give you the option to export in multiple formats. Once you know the format Mailchimp accepts, you'll be good to go. :)
creator: davidsk
